docs.title: Installing NCOS with Calamares
docs.text: The Calamares installer simplifies the NCOS installation process with an intuitive, graphical interface. Follow the steps below to install NCOS on your system.

docs.title: Step 1: Boot into the Live Environment
docs.text:
• Insert the bootable USB drive containing the NCOS ISO into your computer.
  • Restart the system and boot from the USB drive. (Refer to the Pre-Installation Guide if needed.)
  • Once the system boots, you'll enter the NCOS live environment.

docs.title: Step 2: Launch the Calamares Installer
docs.text:
• On the desktop or in the system menu, locate and click the "Install NCOS" icon to launch the Calamares installer.
  • The Calamares installer interface will guide you through the process step by step.

docs.title: Step 3: Choose Your Language
docs.text:
• On the first screen, select your preferred language for the installation.
  • Click "Next" to proceed.

docs.title: Step 4: Select Your Region and Time Zone
docs.text:
• Choose your region and time zone from the map or dropdown menu.
  • Click "Next" to continue.

docs.title: Step 5: Configure Your Keyboard Layout
docs.text:
• Select your keyboard layout and variant (e.g., US, UK, or other).
  • Use the test field to ensure your keyboard is set up correctly.
  • Click "Next" when you're ready.

docs.title: Step 6: Partition Your Disk
docs.text: The partitioning step allows you to define how NCOS will be installed on your storage device. You have two main options:

docs.title: Option 1: Erase Disk
docs.text:
• Select "Erase Disk" to automatically partition your entire disk for NCOS.
  • (Optional) Check the box to enable encryption and set a passphrase for added security.

docs.title: Option 2: Manual Partitioning
docs.text:
• Choose "Manual Partitioning" for advanced users who want to create and configure partitions manually.

  • Ensure you create at least:

    • A root (/) partition with sufficient space.
    • (Optional) A separate /home partition for personal files.
    • A swap partition (if required by your system).

  • Click "Next" once your partition scheme is ready.

docs.title: Step 7: Set Your User Account
docs.text:
• Enter a username, hostname, and password for your account.
  • (Optional) Check the box to log in automatically without a password.
  • Click "Next" to proceed.

docs.title: Step 8: Review Installation Summary
docs.text:
• Review the installation summary, which includes your selected options.
  • Confirm that everything is correct.
  • Click "Install" to begin the installation.

docs.title: Step 9: Wait for the Installation to Complete
docs.text:
• The installer will now copy files, configure the system, and install NCOS on your disk.
  • This process may take a few minutes.

docs.title: Step 10: Restart Your System
docs.text:
• Once the installation is complete, click "Restart Now" and remove the USB drive when prompted.
  • Your system will reboot into your newly installed NCOS.

You're all set! Welcome to NCOS. 🎉 Explore and enjoy your new operating system. If you encounter any issues, visit the Troubleshooting page for assistance.

docs.title: Pre-Installation Guide
docs.text: Before installing NCOS, follow these steps to prepare your system:

docs.title: Download the NCOS ISO
docs.text:
• Visit the NCOS official website for the download link.
  • Download the latest NCOS ISO file.

docs.title: Flash the ISO to a USB Drive
docs.text:
You need to create a bootable USB drive using the NCOS ISO. Here are two recommended tools:

WindowsLinux
  • Download and install Rufus on your Windows PC.
  • Open Rufus.
  • Select your USB drive from the "Device" dropdown menu.
  • Click "Select" and choose the NCOS ISO file.
  • Ensure the "Partition scheme" is set to GPT.
  • Leave the file system settings as default (usually FAT32).
  • Click "Start" to begin creating the bootable USB.
  • Once complete, safely eject the USB drive.
  • Download and install Etcher on your system.
  • Open Etcher.
  • Click "Flash from file" and select the NCOS ISO file.
  • Insert your USB drive, and Etcher will automatically detect it.
  • Click "Flash" to begin writing the ISO to the USB drive.
  • Wait for the process to complete.
  • Safely remove the USB drive from your system.

docs.title: Configure Your BIOS and Boot from USB
docs.text:
To boot into the NCOS live environment, follow these steps:

  1. Access the BIOS/UEFI:

    • Restart your computer and enter the BIOS/UEFI settings. The key to access the BIOS varies by manufacturer (e.g., F2, F10, Del, or Esc). Consult your system's manual for details.

  2. Disable Secure Boot:

    • Locate the Secure Boot option in your BIOS settings.
    • Disable Secure Boot to allow booting from the NCOS USB.

  3. Set USB as Boot Priority:

    • Navigate to the Boot Menu in your BIOS.
    • Set the USB drive as the first boot device.

  4. Save and Exit:

    • Save your changes and exit the BIOS.

docs.title: Step 4: Enter the Live Environment
docs.text:
• Insert your bootable USB drive into the target machine.
  • Restart the system. It should boot directly into the NCOS live environment.
  • If it doesn't boot, ensure that the USB is set as the first boot device in the BIOS settings.

docs.title: You're now ready to proceed with the Installation Process!
Get Started
docs.text:
Whether you're a new user or a seasoned developer, this documentation will guide you through every aspect of NCOS. Here's what you can find:

  • Installation Guide: Step-by-step instructions to install NCOS.
  • Getting Started: Learn the basics

docs.title: Contribute to NCOS
docs.text:
NCOS is a community-driven project, and your contributions are welcome! Whether you're reporting a bug, submitting a patch, or improving this documentation, every bit helps.

Visit our GitHub repository to get involved.

📘 Tip: Use the search bar at the top to quickly find topics of interest.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Custom Brave Browser Extension: Added a custom extension for the Brave browser that allows users to effortlessly pull out a specific tab into a new window.
Instructions to Apply Brave Update

  1. Load the Extension

    • Open brave://extensions/.
    • Enable Developer Mode.
    • Click Load unpacked and select the BraveExtension folder in /.config/.

  2. Use the Shortcut

    • Press Ctrl+Shift+X (or your chosen shortcut) to detach the current tab into a new window.

docs.title: Add NCOS Repository
docs.text: Follow these steps to add the NCOS repository to your system and access NCOS-specific packages.

docs.title: Steps to Add the NCOS Repository
docs.text:
1.Open pacman.conf file:

Use the following command to open the pacman.conf file in Sublime Text:

subl /etc/pacman.conf
2. Add NCOS repository configuration:

Append the following text to the end of the file:

[ncos]
SigLevel = Optional TrustAll
Server = https://raw.githubusercontent.com/exothermic88/ncos-repo/main/$arch
3. Synchronize NCOS repository:

Run the following command to add the NCOS repository to pacman (1):

  1. To learn more about pacman for package maintanance, refer to the arch wiki. 

sudo pacman -Syy
4. Install NCOS-specific package:

Use the following command to install a NCOS package:

sudo pacman -S ncos-package_name

Example

sudo pacman -S ncos-hotfix

  1. Apply the update:

Run this command to apply the update:

ncos-package_name

Example

ncos-hotfix

docs.title: Future Updates
docs.text:
When future updates are released for ncos packages that you have already installed, they will be automatically downloaded when you update your system packages using sudo pacman -Syu.

  • To apply the updates, simply run the following command:
ncos-package_name
